      • addNewUser

        @PostMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> addNewUser(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                              @Valid UserRepresentation userRepresentation)
        Called with POST /users and body with JSON {"name":"b","email":"c"}
        Parameters:
        userRepresentation - - serialized data of a user (name, email)
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and HttpStatus.CREATED

      • updateUser

        @PutMapping(path="/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> updateUser(@PathVariable
                                                                                           java.lang.Integer id,
                                                                                           @RequestBody
                                                                                           User user)
        Called with PUT users/1 and body with JSON {"name":"a", "email":"b"} id only needed in url
        Parameters:
        id - - the id of a user
        user - - serialized data of a user (name, email)
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and user if not found HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST, else the saved user, and HttpStatus.ACCEPTED

      • deleteUser

        @DeleteMapping(path="/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> deleteUser(@PathVariable
                                                                                              java.lang.Integer id)
        Called with DELETE users/1
        Parameters:
        id - - the id of a user
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and if user not found HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND, else HttpStatus.OK
